result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik L Bednar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Dismissal to Defendant returned, moved - left no address
and Affidavit for attorney fees - Andrew Harrington $861.00

(Clerked by APavick)
Defendant Erik L Bednar in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CM60, 15CM447, 15CM67 AND 15CM260

15CM60:
Count #1:  State moves to amend to delete the domestic abuse enhancer.  Court grants motion.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.

Imposed and stayed:  90 days jail with Huber and good time
1 year probation
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO
No contact with Michelle J. subject to approval of agent
Pay court costs (bond posted to apply)

15CM67:
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Pay court costs
15 days jail consecutive to 15CM260, with Huber privileges and credit for one day served. Report to jail today by 3:30 PM

15CM260:
Count #4:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Pay court costs
15 days county jail consecutive to 15CM67, with Huber and good time

 15CM447:
State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.

Any cash posted in above cases to apply to court costs.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.  Report immediately.

Defendant Erik L Bednar in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM60, 15CM67, 15CM260 and 15CM447 called.  Reset -  Plea hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
COVERS 15CM60, 15CM67, 15CM260, 15CM447.  Attorney Fees - $50.0 per month by wage assignment to continue - Andrew Harrington.  (Case 15CM447 added to previous wage assignment.)

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

  Daily PBT's at Rice Lake PD at 6 PM.
  Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
  Must have no contact with Michelle Jordahl

10/13/2015 THIS BOND IS MODIFIED AS FOLLOWS:  Daily PBTs be suspended for the certain periods of time that Mr. Bednar is out of state for work and are reinstated when he is back in Barron County.  Mr. Bednar must provide dates/a specific schedule of when he will be out of state for work to the District Attorney and Police Department.  Daily PBTs continue until those dates are provided. 
ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Erik L Bednar in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond relates and requests bond modification to remove daily PBT condition.  State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Court relates and orders daily PBTs be suspended for the certain periods of time that Mr. Bednar is out of state for work and are reinstated when he is back in Barron County.  Mr. Bednar must provide dates/a specific schedule of when he will be out of state for work to the District Attorney and Police Department.  Daily PBTs continue until those dates are provided.
Court appoints Andrew Harrington to represent on this case as well.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

  Daily PBT's at Rice Lake PD at 6 PM.
  Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
  Must have no contact with Michelle J.

Defendant Erik L Bednar in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Erik L Bednar in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Waives reading of compliant;
Plea of Not Guilty

Defendant now  qulifies for public defender/    15CM260Atorney Andrew Harrington,
  Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
